name: existential
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also existentialist) relating to a philosophy (= system of ideas) according to which the world has no meaning and each person is alone and completely responsible for his or her own actions: an existential argument/philosopher a novel of existential dread See
existentialism
relating to existence or being alive: The biggest existential threat to humans is probably still nuclear war. This remote part of Western Australia represents a serious existential challenge.
More examplesFewer examplesAs a young artist not knowing how to define himself, he faced an existential crisis.There is no answer to that existential question.French philosophers even described what the footballer had done as being an existential act.The film could be described as an existential comedy.He said that, though a serious concern, terrorism shouldn’t be thought of as an existential threat.It's an exaggeration to say he poses an existential danger to democracy.
